rows.TITLE: Cannot get last insert id from database
Cannot  count rows affected by query
Multiple user credentials found for data connection
Data connection not found in model
Cannot undo action: action not found in history
Action not aplicable to input object
Cannot find placeholder value in input data of action
Not allowed to read data without knowing which widget called the read action
Action cannot be undone in principle
Object basket context requested for non-existant meta object
Cannot find right key column for a left join
Cannot merge non-empty data sheets for different objects
Cannot merge data sheets without UID columns
Unsupported data connector for SQL reverse engineering. Currently supported are MySQL, Oracle SQL and Microsoft SQL
Cannot diff columns by UID if one of the data sheets does not have a UID-column or that column is empty
Invalid formula in data sheet column
Cannot fill column with default values
Cannot join data sheets if one of the key columns is not specified
Importing rows from another sheet is only possible if both sheets are based on the same object
Cannot import rows from another sheet if sheets have different amounts of rows
Joining subsheets via reverse relations the explicitly specified foreign keys, not implemented yet!
Updating attributes from reverse relations is not possible
Cannot delete redundant rows while replacing data if no filter are defined!
Cannot delete redundant rows if no UID column is present in the data sheet
Invalid sort direction. Only ASC and DESC are allowed!
Creating rows from an update statement without a UID-column not supported yet!
Cannot delete all instances. Forbidden operation!
Cannot commit a transaction, that has already been rolled back!
Cannot roll back a transaction, that has already been committed!
Invalid query type passed to data connector
Cannot perform quick search on object
Cannot check for concurrent writes on mass updates via filters
Invalid or missing chart widget configuration
Missing data configuration for data-visualization widget
Invalid or missing diagram widget configuration
Tabs widget: Invalid position for tab ribbon
Widget has no meta object
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Every widget showing data must have a reference to it's main meta object. This reference can either be set directly in the widget's UXON description via the "object_alias" property or will be inherited automatically from the widget's parent.

Generally it is a good idea to always specify an object_alias for the root widget of every page - even if it is a container with widgets based on other objects. It is no problem to specify a different object for a child widget!

rows.TITLE: Invalid or missing button action configuration
Malformed relation path
rows.DESCRIPTION:
A relation path consists of relation/attribute aliases concatenated via "__" (double underscore). Each relation alias may include a modifier enclosed in square brackets. In case of reverse relations (1-to-N), the alias will mostly include an aggregator function separated by a semicolon.

Examples (based on an imaginary meta object COMPANY):

- `Billing_ADDRESS__STREET` - the street name of the company's billing address
- `ORDER[PAYEE]__ORDER_NO:COUNT` - number of orders, where the company is the payee
- `EMPLOYEE__ID:COUNT` - number of employees of the compay (no modifier needed as there is only one relation from EMPLOYEE to COMPANY. `EMPLOYEE[COMPANY]__ID:COUNT` would work too, of course.

rows.TITLE: Invalid column configuration for data widget
Cannot add instance to object basket
Invalid text/value configuration for ComboTable widget
Invalid configuration of the StateInputSelect widget
Invalid button widget type
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error indicates, that a non-button was added to the buttons property of a widget. You may overwrite the widget type of each individual button, to make it a special type of button (e.g. a MenuButton), but it still must be a button: you can't use an input widget or so.

rows.TITLE: Unknown widget property
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error indicates, that a property was used in the description of the widget, which is not known for the selected widget type. Please refer to the widget reference in Administration > Core > Widgets.

rows.TITLE: Cannot automatically determine the current object namespace
Invalid configuration for column totals in a data sheet
Invalid configuration for sorters in a data sheet
Missing UID attribute for meta object
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error indicates, that a meta object does not have a UID attribute, but the current runtime requires it. Please mark one of the attributes as object UID.

In general, an object does not neccessarily need a UID attribute. However, certain actions or query builders require it for their logic to function correctly.

rows.TITLE: Missing UID column in data-widget
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs if a data widget (DataTable, DataMatrix, Chart, etc.) has no UID column, but it is required for the current configuration (e.g. for button actions). 

To solve the problem, either add a UID attribute to the main object of the widget or specify a custom uid_column_id in the UXON configuration.

rows.TITLE: No value or  attribute found for a select widget
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error indicates, that the attributes are neither specified, nor could they be guessed.

Select widgets like InputSelect or InputCombo require a value attribute and a text attribute to be rendered. The system will try to determine suitable attributes automatically if the respective properties (value_attribute_alias, text_attribute_alias) are not set. 

Please refer to the widget documentation for detailed information on how the attributes are determined.

rows.TITLE: Missing values for placeholders in the file path
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error indicates, that a required file path contains one or more placeholders, that could not be resolved from the current set of filters.

rows.TITLE: Invalid meta model configuration for an object
Internal widget error
rows.DESCRIPTION: This indicates a programmatic error in the internal logic of a widget. Please contact the support!

rows.TITLE: Internal error
rows.DESCRIPTION: This indicates a programmatic error in the internal logic. Please contact the support!

rows.TITLE: Meta object not found
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs when an object is requested from the meta model, but cannot be found. The error text mostly shows, which object id or alias was requested.

If the object was requested by alias, make sure, it's a fully qualified prefixed by the app alias (e.g. exface.Core.MyObject instead of simply MyObject).

rows.TITLE: Meta attribute not found
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error occurs when an attribute is requested from the meta model, but cannot be found. The error text mostly shows, which attribute alias was requested.

rows.TITLE: Access denied for requested context
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error indicates, that the current user cannot access the specified context. Many contexts require specific user rights. 

Inaccessible contexts are automatically hidden from the context bar.

rows.TITLE: Invalid value for a widget property in UXON
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error indicates, that an illegal value was assigned to a widget property in it's UXON description. See the error subtitle for details. 

If you are editing your Screens right know, you can see the UXON-code of the faulty widget in the respective tabs.

rows.TITLE: Unknown widget property specified
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error indicates, that an illegal or misspelled widget property name was used in the UXON description: see the subtitle for details.

The most common cause for these errors are typos in the UXON configuration. If you are editing your Screens right know, you can see the UXON-code of the faulty widget in the respective tabs.

rows.TITLE: Invalid comparator used!
rows.DESCRIPTION:
The following expressions are supported as comparators:
- '[' - in
- '![' - not in
- '=' - is (default)
- '!=' - is not
- '==' - equals
- '!==' - equals not
- '<' - less
- '<=' - less or equals
- '>' - greater
- '>=' - greater or equals

rows.TITLE: Invalid date format
rows.DESCRIPTION:
The following date input formats are supported:
- 31.12.2017.
- 2017-12-31.
- 2017 (2017-01-01 will be assumed).
- 12.2017 or 12-2017 (2017-12-01 will be assumed).
- 15.02 or 15-02 (2017-02-15 will be assumed).
- +1d, +2w, +3m, +4y for adding days, weeks, months or years to the current date.
- -4d, -3w, -2m, -1y for subtracting days, weeks, months or years from the current date.

rows.TITLE: Invalid widget alignment value
rows.DESCRIPTION:
The "align" property of an alignable widget takes the following values:

- left
- right
- center
- default (the default alignment for the widget type in the current template)
- opposite (the inverse to the default alignment: e.g. "right" if the default is "left")

rows.TITLE: UI page not found
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error means, that a referenced page cannot be found.

This mostly happens due to misspelled page references in widget links or references to pages that were not installed or deleted on the current installation. 

If this error happens when editing a page, make sure all pages, you specified widget links to, really exist in the CMS!

rows.TITLE: Invalid argument in aggregator COUNT_IF
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error means, that the condition passed as argument to the COUNT_IF aggregator is invalid. 

This aggregator counts values of the attribute it is applied to, that match the specified condition. The condition MUST contain a comparator and a value separated by a space. 

Valid examples:

- Count products with a price of 10 or more: PRODUCTS__PRICE:COUNT(>= 10)
- Count completed tasks: TASKS__COMPLETED_FLAG(= 1)

rows.TITLE: Invalid numeric data type configuration
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Numeric data types (based on the NumberDataType prototype) take the following configuration values:

- min - minimum valid value (must be less or equal, than max)
- max - maximum valid value (must be greater or equal than min)
- precision_min - minimum number of decimal places (must be less or equal, than precision_max)
- precision_max - maximum number of decimal places (must be greater or equal, than presision_min)
- precision - fixed precision (the same as setting the same value for precision_min and precision_max)

rows.TITLE: Model entity aliases can only contain letters, digits and '_', but may not start with '_'!
rows.DESCRIPTION: Aliases of meta model entities can only contain any upper and lower case letters, digits and underscores. However they may not start with an underscore '_'.

rows.TITLE: Not a valid value
rows.DESCRIPTION: The given value does not match any of the valid values defined in an enumeration data type.

rows.TITLE: Invalid configuration for enumeration data type
Cannot override values in static enumeration data types
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Valid values for wtatic enumeration data types are defined in the source code. They cannot be overridden in the model of the data type. 

This behavior is intended because static enumerations can be used in both, the source code and in the meta model. This means, that their values must be supported by the source code. For example, data sorters will support sorting directions ASC and DESC defined in the exface.Core.SortingDirectionsDataType - it does not make sense to change or extend them as the sorters will not know, what to do with the new values.

rows.TITLE: This UI page is not part of any app.
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error occurs if an app is requested from a UiPage which is not part of any app.

rows.TITLE: The UID of this UI page isn't unique.
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs if several UI pages have the same UID.

This problem has to be solved by direct manipulation of the page UID template variables in the database (modx_site_tmplvar_contentvalues).

rows.TITLE: This UI page has no UID.
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs an UI page has no UID.

This problem might be solved by recreation of the page or by direct manipulation of the page UID template variable in the database (modx_site_tmplvar_contentvalues).

rows.TITLE: Error creating Ui page.
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error occurs when a problem creating a Ui page occurs.

rows.TITLE: Error updating Ui page.
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error occurs when a problem updating a Ui page occurs.

rows.TITLE: Model builder not available for selected data connector
Invalid tree widget configuration
rows.DESCRIPTION:
The configuration for the tree structure within a widget based on a hierarchy is missing or invalid. Widgets like DataTree or ComboTree contain a Tree widget internally, that defines the hierarchy structure. When creating on of those widgets, the "tree" property must contain a valid tree definition.

Please refer to the description of the Tree widget for more information.

rows.TITLE: Cannot delete dependent data
rows.DESCRIPTION:
When trying to delete a business object, the system automatically looks for related data, that depends on it and attempts to remove it first. This error indicates, that this operation failed.

Removing dependent data is important as it would become meaningless garbage without the object it depends on: e.g. an order position cannot exist if the order was physically deleted.

If the related data cannot be removed automatically, you should try deleting it manually and retry the failed delete operation.

rows.TITLE: No data source defined for object
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs if an operation requiring a data source (e.g. reading or writing) was called on an object that does not have one. 

Objects without data sources are quite legitimate. For example, they can be used to model the input data for an action, which is not a direct replica of data source entry. However, these objects only exist in the runtime. If an attempt is made to persist such an object, this error will occur.

rows.TITLE: Error in metamodel: relations to objects without primary keys (UIDs) must have an explicit key attribute
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs if a relation, that does not have a specific target key attribute, points to an object without a primary key (UID attribute).

Normally you do not have to specify, which attribute of the related object is to be used as key. By default, the UID of that object is used. This, of course, does not work, if there is no UID attribute. So you should either specify, which attribute the relation is attached to or add a UID to the target object.

rows.TITLE: Error in metamodel: orphaned model components detected
rows.DESCRIPTION: This error indicates, that an instance of a model component references a non-existant entity: e.g. an attribute for an object, that does not exist. See specific error text for details.

rows.TITLE: Ambiguous relation alias
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error occurs, when a relation within an alias expression is ambiguously defined: that is, multiple relations matching the alias were found. 

This happens typically, when the relations modifier (the square-brackets-part) is omitted in reverse relations. Since the alias of the right object is used in relation paths for reverse relations, there can easily be multiple reverse relations with the same alias. 

Consider the following example with a meta object ORDER, which has two different relations to the object COMPANY: PAYEE and CONTRACTOR. The expression COMPANY__ORDER (all order of a company) is ambiguous, because it is unclear, which relation is meant, so the correct notation would be COMPANY__ORDER[PAYEE] or COMPANY__ORDER[CONTRACTOR]. 

The part in square brackets is called *modifier* and is required for reverse relations, unless one of the following conditions applies:

- There is only one relation from the right to the left object (e.g. if there would be only one relation from ORDER to COMPANY)
- There are multiple relations, but only one of them is required for the right object (e.g. only PAYEE would be required for ORDER) - in this case, the required relations is used by default.

In any case, the full notation with the modifier is allways possible. The short one is just a convenience shortcut.

rows.TITLE: Object not writeable!
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Writing operations can be explicitly disabled in the metamodel by removing the property "writable" from 

- the object, 
- it's data source, or
- a specific connection. 

In this case, writing attempts will fail even before a transaction is started or the data is passed to the corresponding query builder!

rows.TITLE: Object has no LABEL attribute
rows.HINT: The UID will be used to display the object by default: e.g. in drop-downs, etc.

rows.TITLE: Object has no UID attribute
rows.HINT: It cannot be used with core actions, in dropdown-filters, etc.

rows.TITLE: An object without a data source cannot be readable!
rows.HINT: This object is marked as readable, but has no data source or an empty data address.

rows.TITLE: Object has no attributes!
rows.HINT: Neither this object nor objects it inerits from have any attributes.

rows.TITLE: Object is not readable, but has readable attributes
rows.HINT: It will not be possible to read any of these attributes.

rows.TITLE: Object has multiple LABEL-attributes!
rows.HINT: Make sure, only one attribute is marked as object label! Until then, the first one will be used.

rows.TITLE: Attempting to read data for a non-readable object
Object already exists!
rows.DESCRIPTION:
This error means, that at least one of the object, you tried to create already exists in the data source and cannot be created a second time. This is typically caused by unique constraints of different types: e.g.

- trying to create multiple object with the same unique name or id
- trying to assign a child object to it's parent multiple times (e.g. the same user role to a signle user)  

To solve the ussue, simply search for the existing object and use it instead of creating a new one.
rows.HINT: Use existing objects instead of creating new ones.

rows.TITLE: Invalid time format
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Supported input formats are:
 
 - `hh:mm`, `hh:mm AM/PM` (e.g. "13:59" or "01:59 PM")
 - `hh:mm:ss`, `hh:mm:ss AM/PM` (e.g. "13:59:31" or "01:59:31 PM")
 - `hhmm` (eg. 1359)

rows.TITLE: Invalid value for a numeric string
rows.HINT: Numeric strings can only conatin number characters (0-9) - no minuses, delimiters, spaces, etc.

rows.TITLE: Invalid UXON property
rows.DESCRIPTION:
The provided UXON configuration cannot be applied to the selected prototype because the prototype does not recognize one of the properties.

This is a typical error for misspelled or misplaced UXON properties. You can find all UXON properties supported by a prototype in the documentation: go to Administration > Documentation and navigate to the desired prototype section (e.g. widgets, actions, etc.).
rows.HINT: Please, correct the UXON code shown in the tab "UXON" of this error message or pick another prototype.

rows.TITLE: Invalid app alias
rows.DESCRIPTION:
The alias must consist of two parts separated by a dot: the vendor (namespace) and the actual app alias. Both, vendor name and alias may contain letters, numbers and underscores.

The app's alias will automatically be used to name the package, which the app will be exported to. So, if you plan to add PHP code to the package, it is a good idea to make the alias adhere to the PSR2 standard: use lowercase for vendor and PascalCase for the app alias.

Here are some typical examples:

- exface.Core
- mycompany.MyAppWithPSRCompilantAlias
- me.my_very_long_app_name

rows.TITLE: Incompatible PHP options detected in WebConsole facade: streaming not possible!
Cannot connect to Micrsoft SQL Server
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Connecting to Microsoft SQL Server via SQL requires:

- The PHP extension "sqlsrv" being enabled (downloadable it from [GitHub](https://github.com/Microsoft/msphpsql/releases))
- The Microsoft ODBC driver matching the version of your server installed (downloadable from [Microsoft](https://docs.microsoft.com/de-de/sql/connect/odbc/download-odbc-driver-for-sql-server))

rows.TITLE: Cannot connect to Oracle SQL
rows.DESCRIPTION:
Connecting to Oracle SQL requires:

- The **oci8** PHP extension matching your database version (e.g. oci8_12c)
- The corresponding Version of the Oracle InstantClient accessible via command line (e.g. registered in the PATH on Windows).

rows.TITLE: Linked data missing
rows.DESCRIPTION: Some widgets like `Chart` or `KPI` can use the data of another widget to decrease loading overhead. However, in this case, the target widget specified in `data_widget_link` must have all the columns needed. This error indicates, that this is not the case.
rows.HINT: Make sure, the data widget, that is used a linked data in other widgets has all the required columns for all linked widgets.

rows.TITLE: No valid data connection for SQL installer
rows.HINT: Please add a connection to the model of the data source below and reinstall/repair the app.

rows.TITLE: Error generating model from data source
